Description: B cells infiltrate human malignancies but their contribution to anti-tumor immune responses is not fully understood. The ability of B cells to modulate cancer growth has been attributed to antibody production, antigen presentation, cytokine release, and immunosuppression, emphasizing the need to better visualize and understand the heterogeneity of B cell responses in cancer. In this session, we will discuss recent preclinical, computational, and translational strategies that highlight how B cell responses are shaped in cancer, evaluate intratumoral B cell maturation as a factor in immunotherapy responsiveness and provide emerging spatial landscape of tumor-associated B cells.
SearchResultBody: SY16. B Cell Responses and Tertiary Lymphoid Structures in Cancer
Title: B Cell Responses and Tertiary Lymphoid Structures in Cancer
